content: Learn more about {{license}} Edition on the <1>official website</1>

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a brief message about licensing information on the official website when users upgrade to a Pro edition. It appears in a banner or notification within the application. Translators should provide a clear and concise description of the enterprise license for this context.

usage.context:
<Text
 fontWeight={600}
 color={theme.client.settings.payment.contactContainer.textColor}
 >
 <Trans
 i18nKey="UpgradeToProBannerInformationAboutShort"
 ns="PaymentsEnterprise"
 t={t}
 values={{ license: t("Common:EnterpriseLicense") }}
 components={{
 1: (

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>` are not consistently applied. The closing tag should be `</1>` to match the opening tag.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent use of `<1>` and `</1>` for the relevant link.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag <1> is inconsistent. The English source uses <1> for the link, while the Azerbaijani translation uses the same tag. It's preferable to maintain consistency if possible.  However, given the context of user interface elements, it's likely intended to signify a link and is acceptable in this case.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review and ensure consistent HTML tag usage for links.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent. The English uses <1> and </1>, while the Spanish uses the same tags.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent HTML tag usage. Either use <1> and </1> in both languages, or use a different tag format.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English content uses HTML tags <1> and </1> for the 'official website' link. The Finnish translation does not maintain this formatting. The term 'official website' is not wrapped in HTML tags.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Lue lisää {{license}} -versiosta <1>virallisella verkkosivustolla</1>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'official website' should be translated to 'virallinen verkkosivusto' or 'virallinen sivusto'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Lue lisää {{license}} -versiosta <1>virallisella verkkosivustolla</1>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent with the English original. The English uses <1> and </1>, while the French uses the same tags.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistency in HTML tags: Either change the English to use the French tags (<1> and </1>) or change the French to use the English tags (<1> and </1>).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are present in both the English and Armenian versions. While this isn't inherently incorrect, it's unusual to include these in translatable content. It's best to determine if this formatting is intentional and should be preserved or if it should be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing the <1> and </1> tags if they are not intended to be part of the displayed text.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` are inconsistent. The opening tag uses `<1>` while the closing tag uses `</1>`. This should be consistent.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change `</1>` to `</1>`

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1>...</1> are not consistently applied. The English uses <1>...</1> while the Japanese uses the same tags.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent HTML tag usage. Consider using ... for code snippets, or removing tags if they's only for visual styling.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1>...</1> are not consistently applied. The English content uses <1>...</1> while the Korean translation has the same tags.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent HTML tag usage or remove the tags if they are not necessary for rendering.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are present in both the English and Latvian text. They need to be consistently handled. It's unclear what their intended purpose is without further context. Assuming they represent emphasis or a link, they are correct in their usage.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify the intended purpose of the HTML tags and ensure consistent application across all languages. If they are meant to be removed, do so.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are consistent between the English and Dutch versions. This consistency is important to maintain.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: No change needed. Maintain the existing formatting tags.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent between the English and Portuguese versions. The English uses <1> and </1> while the Portuguese uses the same.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent HTML tag usage across both languages. Either use <1> and </1> in both, or use a different, consistent tag.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>` are not properly closed in the Romanian translation. They should be `<1>...</1>'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Aflați mai multe despre Ediția {{license}} pe <1> pagina oficială </1>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent with English. In English they indicate a link, in Sinhala they do not. Consider removing them or replacing them with appropriate Sinhala link formatting.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the tags <1> and or replace them with Sinhala link markup (e.g., `` and `` tags). If it's meant to be visually distinct, consider using CSS styling instead.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are present in both the English and Serbian content. While technically not an error, maintaining consistency across all translations might be desirable. This depends on the intended rendering behavior.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing or standardizing the HTML tags if they are not essential for rendering.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>` are inconsistent with the English source. The English uses <1> and </1>. The Serbian translation uses the same.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistency in HTML tag usage. Consider using <1> and </1> in the Serbian translation to match the English original or adopt a standard format.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag `<1>` is inconsistent. The English content uses `<1>official website</1>`, while the Turkish translation uses `<1>Resmî web</1>`. The opening tag is the same, but the closing tag is incomplete.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>Resmî web sitesinden</1>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'Resmî web sitesinden' is technically correct, it's a somewhat literal translation of 'official website'. A more natural and fluent Turkish phrasing would be something like 'Resmî web sitesinde' or 'Resmî web sitesini ziyaret edin'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Resmî web sitesinde

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` appear to be used inconsistently with the English content.  They've been retained in the Vietnamese translation but might not be intended or functional in that context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review the intended purpose of the HTML tags and ensure they are correctly implemented in the Vietnamese version, or remove them if not required.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets <1> and </1> are present in both the English and Chinese, which suggests they're intended as formatting tags. It's important to confirm if this is the desired behavior and if the recipient system will correctly interpret these tags.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify the intended purpose of the <1> and </1> tags and ensure they are correctly implemented in the target system.
